content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: visual, easy to understand and fun

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice little puzzle

In addition to 5DN1L's comment, I think that the example should change the placement of several letters, because one may think that ABCD only appear at the beginning of each line. Imo test 4 is a better example.

Goal section
* It's better to add a reminder that each line in the grid may have different widths (i.e. number of characters).

* And, arising from the point above, is it correct to say that a vertical movement is still possible even if there is no character in the path? e.g. in Validator 4, can I go from D by up and then right to X even though there is no character above D?

This may have to be clarified in Goal section.

* Suggest to delete "(or - consists out of two movements: vertical and horizontal)" - I feel that this just adds more confusion than explanation :P

Cases
* Not sure if using whitespaces is a good idea here... Maybe using a character such as {{.}} will help the players visualise things better?

Thanks.
I think I resolved all comments, and made the input more straightforward, by shifting to a 4*10 grid, filled with dots. Thanks for the good remarks!

Good point - only the first test case is automatically the example, and I want the first test case to be the most easy one (just on the same line). To resolve your point I have changed the first testcase (and therefore example) by moving all letters 'into the grid'.
